items.title: Chart of the Day | India Inc’s debt cushion remains strong despite marginal dip in interest coverage
items.description: According to BoB Research, Indian industry remains well-positioned to meet its debt obligations, as reflected by the ICR. Despite the marginal dip, the ICR remains high by historical standards

items.title: How does oil supply dynamics shape up in the new world order?
items.description: Weak consumption trend can depress oil prices as supply is poised to increase

items.title: Gabriel India: Positioned well to benefit from traditional, new businesses
items.description: Increased preference for premium products augurs well for the company

items.title: Apple blocks Tinder owner, startups from commercial secrets in India antitrust case
items.description: The investigation process has concluded but CCI's senior members are yet to review the findings and pass a final ruling

items.title: ChrysCapital said to raise $2.1 billion record buyout fund
items.description: The 26-year-old firm’s latest fund is about two-thirds bigger than its last capital raise of $1.25 billion in 2022, and beat the record $1.7 billion raised by India’s Kedaara Capital last year

items.title: India needs to up clean energy game, must aim for 600 GW by 2030: Report
items.description: If India manages only 400 GW of non-fossil capacity by 2030, it could face power shortage and need additional 10-16 GW of coal capacity, the Council on Energy, Environment and Water study has said

items.title: Imported 'blue wafers' banned from solar panels used in government projects to nudge make in India
items.description: Ministry of New and Renewable Energy has ordered that only black wafer, which is the base material for making a solar cell, is allowed to be imported into India. Government wants the process of turning it into a blue wafer to be carried out in India.

items.title: IndusInd is said to be close to completing Reliance Capital acquisition
items.description: An official announcement on the deal could be made in the coming days, the people said, asking not to be identified because the information is private.

items.title: Zydus Lifesciences wants to go beyond the pill, bets big on MedTech with Amplitude buy
items.description: India still relies largely on imported devices and implants, and we want to change that, says Dr Sharvil Patel, MD, Zydus Lifesciences.

items.title: Royal Orchid Hotels: Why this hotel stock is likely to go up
items.description: Given the government’s focus on tourism as a job-creating sector, ROHL is likely to deliver industry-leading growth. The company’s valuations also look attractive

items.title: The case for succession planning at Indian family-owned businesses
items.description: Indian billionaire families increasingly prefer investment management over active business roles, raising succession concerns. Family disputes, weak governance, and promoter dominance threaten business stability. Robust succession frameworks, professional leadership, and regulatory compliance are crucial for corporate governance, investor confidence, and sustainable long-term growth
